# What's the Output?

::: notes
Focus: return values, basic level, 24 lines
::: 

## Exercise Goals

- Review of code syntax
- Check understanding of syntax
- Understand how return values work in functions

## What to Do

- Using the given code ...
- Trace each function call and its return value
- Compute the output (**MANUALLY**)

## What's the Output?

```{.cpp} 
//WhatsTheOutput_Functions.cpp
#include <iostream>
using namespace std;
int add(int, int);
int multiply(int, int);
int subtract(int, int);
int main() {
    int x = 5, y = 3;
    cout << add(x, y) << endl;
    cout << multiply(x, y) << endl;
    cout << subtract(x, y) << endl;
    cout << add(10, 20) << endl;
    cout << add(x, y) + 10 << endl;
    return 0;
}
int add(int a, int b) {
    return a + b;
}
int multiply(int a, int b) {
    return a * b;
}
int subtract(int a, int b) {
    return a - b;
}
```

    cout << add(10, 20) << endl;
    cout << add(x, y) + 10 << endl;
    return 0;
}
int add(int a, int b) {
    return a + b;
}

    return a * b;
}

}
